attributes.action: To put pressure on Wirral Borough Council to restore and re-open Bidston Air Raid Shelter, to the public for use as a tourist attraction.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Situated under Bidston Hill, the Bidston Air Raid Shelters were built for use in World War 2 and have been in-accessible to the public since the 1950's.
Originally, the 7foot tall and 6 foot 6inch wide tunnels contained space for 2,213 bunks, 793 seats, a canteen, staff dormitories, medical aid posts and a ventilation shaft that also doubled up as an emergency escape hatch.
We would like these tunnels to be restored and re-opened to the public.
